chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcell P Wilburn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to sentence in Count 3 if revoked.

Court grants 98 days credit.

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Take Thinking for a Change Course.  Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at the Agent's discretion.  Huber privileges at the Agent's discretion.
To be completed as a condition of probation as directed by Agent.

Take Thinking for a Change Course.  Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  

Perform 20 hours of community service.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Filed by DOC regarding sentence structure. **Reviewed by Judge Martens - no action taken**
Amended Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered filed in Court.

08:54 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Marcell P Wilburn in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes an amended plea questionnaire has been filed and inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Atty. Meyeroff confirms his client is prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing today.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Meyeroff confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 & 3, Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 3.  Court orders Count 2 dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Zilavy.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Meyeroff.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

3 Years Imprisonment (98 Days Credit and Concurrent to sentence in Count 3 IF revoked)
-	1 Year & 6 Months of Initial Confinement
-	1 Year & 6 Months of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Term of Probation: 3 Years

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision (IF revoked):
-	Take Thinking for a Change Course;
-	Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license;
-	Perform 20 hours of community service.

Condition Time: 6 Months STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion (Huber privileges at the Agent's discretion)

FINE:  $404.00;

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  



COUNT 3:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

9 Months Jail Straight Time (98 Days Credit and sentence to be concurrent to sentence in Count 1 IF revoked).

Term of Probation: 1 Year

Conditions of Probation:
-	Take Thinking for a Change Course;
-	Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license;
-	Perform 20 hours of community service.

FINE or COSTS:  Waived by the Court.

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered filed by Atty. Meyeroff.  NOTE:  The plea boxes are not checked, one of the counts is not from this case, and missing a count according to the offer filed. (am)
Plea agreement filed by Atty. Meyeroff.
prelim hearing for 4/8/22

09:42 AM; Case called for Jury status hearing.  Defendant Marcell P Wilburn in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that the defendant filed an inmate communication form requesting a transcript.  Court advises the defendant to discuss that with his attorney who can contact the appropriate Court Reporter to obtain the transcript.  Court inquires how the matter is proceeding as it is set for trial next week.  Atty. Meyeroff provides an update, he is requesting that bail be addressed today, as he filed a motion, and will need to request an adjournment of the trial.  Court addresses counsel with regards to the request to adjourn the trial, and is concerned about rescheduling the matter.  Court inquires if State is prepared to address bail today.  State advises they are prepared to argue bail today and also notes that as they only have 1 witness and the squad video they believe this will only be a 1 day trial and are prepared to proceed.  Court will first address Atty. Meyeroff's motion to modify bail.  Atty. Meyeroff presents arguments; he is requesting a signature bond.  Atty. Zilavy objects and presents arguments.  For all reasons set forth by the State in their arguments the Court will deny the motion to modify bail.  Bail to remain as previously set.  Court will maintain the jury trial set to begin on 6/28/2022.  Court advises counsel that there is a potential that another trial may go and will advise them by noon today if this will be the trial proceeding next week.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 6/19/22 - defendant requesting transcripts.  **this was addressed at the hearing**
Motion to Reduce Bail filed by Atty. Meyeroff.
Filed by Atty. Meyeroff.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions filed by Atty. Meyeroff.
State's Motion in Limine.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions.
State's Witness List.

Jury status hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:03 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Marcell P Wilburn in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Meyeroff provides an update, he is asking that this matter be set for jury trial and the other matters tag along with for status.  Atty. Meyeroff believes the trial will take no more than 2 days.  Court will schedule this matter for jury status and trial and all other matters will tag along with for status.  Court advises counsel that proposed jury instructions, motions in limine and witness lists are due no later than 48 hours before the jury status hearing.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Meyeroff asking the Court to disregard his previous request to reschedule the 5/18/2022 hearing.  NOTE:  We never received a request for adjournment.
Character letter filed by DB
Hearing on May 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:55 AM Defendant Marcell P Wilburn in court, in custody, with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wisconsin State Patrol Trooper Alexander Polizzi sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Brejcha.  Cross examination by Attorney Meyeroff.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Meyer objects to bind over without argument and moves for dismissal.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:49 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Marcell P Wilburn in court, in custody, with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms with Atty. Meyeroff that he represents the defendant on all of his cases.  Atty. Meyeroff presents arguments regarding his bail motion; he is asking the amount of bail be reduced.  Atty. Gordon objects and presents arguments.  Atty. Meyeroff presents additional statements.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the motion to modify bail, bail remains as previously set.  Court inquires as to how the matter will be proceeding.  Atty. Meyeroff notes the matter is set for a preliminary hearing tomorrow before the Court Commissioner.  Preliminary hearing 04-08-2022 at 08:15 AM.
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.
